title: Lots of fun!
text: Enjoyable musical. Lead female role is huge and really has to work to bring the action along. Great songs, great show. Interesting topics raised to talk over with my teenage companions on the way home!

title: Amazing!
text:
What a fascinating tour underground! Loved it. Loved our knowledgeable and passionate guide. Wonderful opportunity for the whole family to learn more about it.
Fab cafe too!

title: Beautiful!
text: Good 'old fashioned' gardens. Love the planting, the river, the meandering lake. Always plenty of people out taking the air and enjoying them. Lovely atmosphere.

title: Interesting - and could do with a bigger building!
text:
What interesting exhibits! Timeline approach is very interesting, but with the constraints of the building it gets hard to see everything when it is even moderately crowded.
Eclectic exhibitions. Well worth a vist if you are in the area.

title: So helpful and friendly and so interesting!
text: Great range of maps and local guides, plenty of knowledge in the staff members, and lots of bottles ready to fill with the local water from the fountain head in the building. Fascinating information about it all. Recommended!
place: Buxton Visitor Centre and Crescent Experience

title: I can't wait for it to be finished!
text: Glimpses of the buildings, behind the hoardings, and the info boards around make it sounds as though it's going to be wonderful. Not much to see until the hoardings come down though.

title: Stunning, but busy
text: Even on a chilly October day this walk was packed (as were the nearest car parks) - although it was half term. Wonderful views, which is why it is so popular. Well worth it!
place: Ridge Walk Mam Tor to Losehill

title: Windy and wonderful
text: Lovely walk (even for the less fit and able) and fascinating history to be found, as well as wonderful views!

title: Great place and really helpful!
text:
We'd booked a mobility buggy for a post knee replacement op member of the family - the staff made it easy for us to do this and we are very grateful!
THe gardens are truly beautiful - take as much time as you can to enjoy them and explore thoroughly. You will be well rewarded.

title: Best Meal Ever!
text: Declared by my youngest to be her best meal ever, the rest of the family enjoyed ourselves too - so much that on our only other free evening we came back! Good food for both vegetarian and non vegetarians, great value, perfect location in the city centre. We loved it!

title: Amazing Views!
text:
You really get a sense of how large Athens is, how it relates to the sea and the mountains and what other strange bits of rock stick up out of the city! What a great view from here (along with lovely cafe tables to allow you to day dream over the view for even longer).
Interesting paths down through cacti / succulent gardens.

title: What a great way to reach the top!
text: I was surprised that the whole journey was in a tunnel (complete with ads on the walls is that why the windows are so big in the cars?) but when you got to the top, it's amazing! Reliable, quick service that allowed me to access the top, as I am not fit enough to manage the climb otherwise. We went as the sun was about to set and it was beautiful.

title: Stunning!
text: Travelled up by the funicular and was amazed to come out so close to the top and this wonderful chapel. very moving. Highly recommend that you come close to dusk, where the city looks truly lovely.

title: Wow!
text: Views all around. Fascinating archeology (my family found some post holes in the bed rock particularly interesting, showing that there had been timber structures as well as the stone ones that are so well known. A must see if you are in Athens.

title: Stunning - just like you hope it will be!
text: What an amazing place. Fascinating to see what remains, (and what has been / is being repaired and how. Useful info boards in English as well as Greek abound. Highly recommended.

title: Calm space to enjoy
text:
Right in the middle of the tourist area, this is a great place to just soak up the atmosphere whilst looking at 'old stuff' (as my family term it!). I wouldn't go there instead of the Acropolis, but it's an interesting add on if you have time whilst you are in Athens.
The area has lots of good value souvenir shops (and some not such good value ones) and plenty to see.

title: Friendly Service, Good Food, a relaxed lunch
text:
Very pleasant greeting by the restaurant manager, we were handed off to our server Scott, who was both friendly and entertaining!
We had a fab lunch - odd combinations of a side dish ordered as a starter and a a starter ordered as a main were all dealt with easily and well. Our varied party, spanning 60 years from the youngest to oldest, all chose dishes to suit. Vegetarian, diabetic, child-picky, all were catered for.
Delicious food, plenty of vegetables, good service that was attentive without being over the top. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal and plan to return when we are back in Maidstone.
Many thanks to the team, especially Scott, who kept my autistic teenager engaged with the whole dining out process in the most charming way.

title: Delicious food and good service
text: Pleasantly busy but not overcrowded. Friendly service with good explanations about the food. Delicious starters, fabulous main courses. We will be back!
